caption.p: V. officinalis extracts reduce SH-SY5Y cell growth. The effect on cell proliferation was evaluated by 3-(4,5-dimethylthiazole-2-yl)-2,5-diphenyltetrazolium bromide (MTT) assay. SH-SY5Y cells were treated with increasing concentration (125–750 µg/mL) for 24, 48 and 72 h of each extract, as showed in figure. 1 = Vo-in vivo— V. officinalis parent plant grown in vivo-herb extract; 2 = Vo-C— V. officinalis callus culture extract; 3 = Vo-S— V. officinalis suspension culture extract; 4 = Vo-STB— V. officinalis stirred-tank bioreactor culture extract. Each value is the mean ± SEM of three different experiments performed in eight replicates. * P < 0.05 vs. ctrl, ** P < 0.01 vs. ctrl, *** P < 0.001 vs. ctrl and **** P < 0.0001 vs. ctrl.
